title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2669/89 of 1 September 1989 opening an invitation to tender for the free supply of olive oil to Poland
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2669/89
of 1 September 1989
opening an invitation to tender for the free supply of olive oil to Poland
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The following intervention agencies:
- Servicio Nacional de Productos Agrarios (Spain), hereinafter called 'SENPA',
- Azienda di Stato per gli interventi nel settore agricolo (Italy), hereinafter called 'AIMA',
shall open an invitation to tender in accordance with the provisions of this Regulation for the supply to Poland, by way of a gift, of 5 000 tonnes of olive oil as defined in point 3 of the Annex to Regulation No 136/66/EEC. 2 500 tonnes shall be allocated in Spain and 2 500 tonnes in Italy.
2. The following raw materials required for the preparation of 5 000 tonnes of olive oil shall be supplied free of charge for this tendering procedure by the intervention agency or agencies:
- 500 tonnes of virgin olive oil other than lampante grade,
- the necessary quantity of lampante virgin olive oil to obtain 4 500 tonnes of refined olive oil in accordance with the formula laid down in Article 17 of Regulation (EEC) No 2960/77.
The book value of the products shall be ECU 1 100 per tonne. Conversion into national currency shall be at the agricultural conversion rate obtaining on 1 August 1989.
3. The end product, obtained by mixing 90 % refined olive oil with 10 % virgin olive oil other than lampante
grade, must be suitable for direct consumption and put up in one-litre containers. The words 'Olive oil - Product of the European Economic Community' must appear on the packaging in Polish and one of the official languages of the Community, together with a code number identifying the packaging plant. No other markings shall be permitted.
4. Offers submitted in response to the invitation to tender shall take account of all the costs involved in the operation, including the withdrawal, refining, mixing, and packaging costs and the cost of delivering the product to the Polish authorities. The product shall be delivered cif to the Polish seaports of Gdynia, Gdansk or Szczecin or, in the case of another form of delivery, at the place indicated by the Polish authorities, according to the following timetable:
- 1 000 tonnes before 1 November 1989,
- 2 500 tonnes during November 1989,
- 1 500 between 1 and 15 December 1989.

The invitation to tender shall be published on 5 September 1989.
The batches of oil for which contracts are to be awarded, each corresponding to 500 tonnes of the end product, and the places where they are stored shall be displayed:
- by 'SENPA', at its head office in Calle Beneficiencia 8, Madrid 28004, Spain,
- by 'AIMA', at its head office in Via Palestro 81, Rome, Italy.
The invitations to tender shall indicate the delivery period for each batch. A copy of the invitation to tender shall be forwarded forthwith to the Commission.

The tenders must reach SENPA, Calle Beneficiencia 8, Madrid 28004, Spain and AIMA, via Palestro 81, Rome, Italy not later than 2 p.m. (local time) on 15 September 1989. They must cover all the costs referred to in Article 1. They shall not be accepted unless they are accompanied by evidence that a security of Ptas 2 800 or Lit 30 000 per 100 kg (whichever is applicable) has been lodged.

SENPA and AIMA shall forward to the Commission not later than three days after the expiry of the time limit fixed for the submission of tenders a list without names indicating the amounts tendered for each batch, expressed in national currency. On the basis of the tenders received, the Commission shall award the batches to the tenderers offering the lowest amounts. Where several identical tenders are submitted for a batch to be awarded, lots shall be drawn. The Commission's decision shall be notified immediately to the Member States concerned.

1. The competent authorities in the Member States shall verify that the oil has been refined, packaged and exported in accordance with the conditions laid down in this Regulation.
2. Removal of the goods shall be conditional on the lodging of a security of (PTA 23 037) or (LIT 322 636) per 100 kilograms of olive oil.
3. The security referred to in Article 3 shall be released if the tender is not accepted or, where a contract is awarded, as soon as the security referred to in paragraph 2 has been lodged.
4. Except in cases of force majeure, the security referred to in paragraph 2 shall, by way of derogation from Article 18 of Regulation (EEC) No 3665/87, by released on presentation of the transport document and the taking-over certificate provided for in the Annex and duly endorsed by the competent Polish authorities.

The products dispatched pursuant to this Regulation shall not qualify for export refunds or consumption aid and shall not be subject to the system of monetary compensatory amounts or accession compensatory amounts.

In the Annex Part II of Regulation (EEC) No 569/88 entitled 'Products subject to a use and/or destination other than that mentioned under I', the following item 31 and footnote are added:
'31. Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2669/89 of 4 September 1989 opening an invitation to tender for the free supply of olive oil to Poland (31).
(a) on the dispatch of lampante virgin olive oil for refining:
- section 104 of the control copy T5:
for refining and export to Poland (Regulation (EEC) No 2669/89);
- section 106 of the control copy T5:
product not subject to a monetary or accession compensatory amount or export refund
(b) on the export of the olive oil:
- section 104 of the control copy T5:
for export to Poland (Regulation (EEC) No 2669/89);
- section 106 of the control copy T5:
product not subject to a monetary or accession compensatory amount or export refund.
(31) OJ No L 257, 2. 9. 1989, p. 20.'

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 1 September 1989.
For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission

ANNEX
I. Model of the taking over certifcate
I the undersigned:
(family name, forename, business name)
on behalf of the Polish government hereby certify that the goods listed below have been taken over:
- Place and date of taking over:
- Product:
- Tonnage (net, gross or gross for net weight) taken over:
- Packaging:
- Number of items:
- Net weight per item (kilograms):
- Marked (endorsement):
The goods delivered are of the quality specified.
